posts.title: Understanding Angular Directive
posts.body: Angular directive are a core feature that allows developers to extend HTML with new attributes and elements This post explores the different types of directives, how to create custom directives, and best practices for using them effectively in your Angular applications.

posts.title: JavaScript ES6 Features You Should Know
posts.body: ES6 introduced many powerful features to JavaScript including arrow functions, template literals, destructuring, and classes that make development more efficient.

posts.title: Building RESTful APIs with Node.js
posts.body: Node.js combined with Express makes it easy to build robust RESTful APIs. Learn about routing, middleware, and best practices for API development.

posts.title: CSS Grid vs Flexbox: When to Use What
posts.body: Both CSS Grid and Flexbox are powerful layout systems, but they serve different purposes. Grid is for two-dimensional layouts while Flexbox is for one-dimensional layouts.

posts.title: Introduction to TypeScript
posts.body: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing. It helps catch errors early and makes large codebases more maintainable.

posts.title: Web Performance Optimization Techniques
posts.body: Learn essential techniques to improve your website's performance including code splitting, lazy loading, image optimization, and caching strategies.

posts.title: Getting Started with React Hooks
posts.body: React Hooks revolutionized functional components by allowing state and lifecycle features without writing classes. Learn useState, useEffect, and custom hooks.

posts.title: Database Design Best Practices
posts.body: Proper database design is crucial for application performance. Learn about normalization, indexing, relationships, and query optimization.

posts.title: Mobile-First Responsive Design
posts.body: Mobile-first design ensures your website works well on all devices. Start with mobile constraints and progressively enhance for larger screens.

posts.title: Git Workflow Strategies
posts.body: Different Git workflows like Git Flow, GitHub Flow, and GitLab Flow offer structured approaches to collaboration and deployment.

posts.title: Docker for Development
posts.body: Docker containers provide consistent development environments. Learn how to containerize your applications and use Docker Compose.

posts.title: Testing Strategies for Web Applications
posts.body: Comprehensive testing includes unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests. Learn about testing frameworks and best practices.

posts.title: Progressive Web Apps (PWA)
posts.body: PWAs combine the best of web and mobile apps with features like offline functionality, push notifications, and home screen installation.

posts.title: Serverless Computing with AWS Lambda
posts.body: Serverless architecture allows you to run code without provisioning servers. Learn about AWS Lambda and its use cases.

posts.title: GraphQL vs REST: Choosing the Right API
posts.body: GraphQL offers more flexibility than REST with its query language, but both have their place depending on your application's needs.

posts.title: Microservices Architecture
posts.body: Microservices break applications into small, independent services that can be developed, deployed, and scaled independently.

posts.title: Serverless Computing with AWS Lambda
posts.body: Serverless architecture allows you to run code without provisioning servers. Learn about AWS Lambda and its use cases.

posts.title: Web Security Best Practices
posts.body: Protect your web applications from common vulnerabilities like XSS, CSRF, and SQL injection with proper security measures.

posts.title: CI/CD Pipeline Setup
posts.body: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment automate testing and deployment processes, improving development efficiency.

posts.title: Machine Learning for Web Developers
posts.body: Learn how to integrate machine learning models into web applications using TensorFlow.js and other JavaScript ML libraries.

posts.title: Web Accessibility (a11y) Guidelines
posts.body: Make your websites accessible to everyone by following WCAG guidelines and implementing proper ARIA attributes and keyboard navigation.

posts.title: Advanced CSS Techniques
posts.body: Explore advanced CSS features like CSS custom properties, blend modes, filters, and scroll snap for modern web design.

posts.title: JavaScript Design Patterns
posts.body: Learn common JavaScript design patterns like Module, Observer, Factory, and Singleton to write more maintainable code.

posts.title: Building Real-time Applications
posts.body: Create real-time features using WebSockets, Socket.IO, or Server-Sent Events for chat apps, live updates, and collaborative tools.

posts.title: Content Management Systems
posts.body: Compare popular CMS options like WordPress, Drupal, and headless CMS solutions for different project requirements.

posts.title: Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
posts.body: Improve your website's visibility in search engines with proper meta tags, structured data, performance optimization, and content strategy.

comments.name: John Doe
comments.body: [updated] Great explanation of directives! I've been struggling to understand when to use isolated scope.

comments.name: Jane Smith
comments.body: This helped me understand the difference between controllers and directives. Thanks!

comments.name: Mike Johnson
comments.body: ES6 arrow functions have completely changed how I write JavaScript. No more 'this' binding issues!

comments.name: Sarah Wilson
comments.body: I've been using Express for years but still learned some new middleware patterns from this post.

comments.name: Tom Brown
comments.body: The Grid vs Flexbox comparison is spot on. I use Grid for overall layout and Flexbox for component layouts.

comments.name: Lisa Chen
comments.body: TypeScript has saved our team so much debugging time. The type safety is invaluable for large projects.

comments.name: David Lee
comments.body: Performance optimization is often overlooked. These techniques improved our Lighthouse score by 30 points!

comments.name: Emily Davis
comments.body: Hooks made React so much cleaner. I can't imagine going back to class components now.

comments.name: Robert Garcia
comments.body: Database indexing is crucial for performance. We reduced query times from seconds to milliseconds with proper indexes.

comments.name: Maria Rodriguez
comments.body: Mobile-first approach completely changed how we design. It forces you to focus on what's truly important.
